quote: ''We need to share power with the people... This is the heart and soul of good governance. This allows decisions at the policy making table to truly be responsive to what people need on the ground and not defined by the crosshairs of politics, economic status, or family name.''

''What I am not in favor of is if those are being inherited by family members para hindi makuha ng iba. 'Yong sa akin, mas mabuti kapag hindi sa iisang pamilya 'yan, wala naman tayong monopoly that has good intentions. Mas mabuti sana kung lahat may equal opportunities to run for office.''
''The ordinary government employees and private sector employees who only depend on their salaries are those who are heavily taxed... those who earn more are those who will have to bear the burden.''
''Ako I am all for it. Alam ko kasi na matagal na inasam ng asawa ko na makatulong kahit papaano na makapagbigay ng ambag pag-achieve ng peace sa Mindanao.''
''Meron tayong arbitration case na nakahain (at) inaantay matapos, naniniwala ako doon.''

''I have nothing against... amendments on the economic provisions of the Constitution. Pero ang sa akin lang, it is a big deal in the sense that it is something that has to be discussed thoroughly in Congress. We have discussed that already. We even reached a point na magbobotohan na sana. Ang sa akin lang noon, kung nagbotohan siguro noon, I would not have voted for it only because I think it was not discussed well. Parang masyadong mabilis 'yong discussion na for something as serious as constitutional change.'' - Interview at TV5 during 'Happy Hour' segment, Nov. 13, 2015

''Equality underscores the human rights principles that are embedded in the laws of the country...The denial of basic fairness, however, is an everyday reality for many Filipinos... Biases against one's sexual orientation or gender identity result in the denial of one's right to education or work.''

''Ito ang mga programang ramdam ng nasa baba na ang kanilang gobyerno ay nagmamahal sa kanila. Ito po ang mga programa ng Daang Matuwid na ramdam ninyong lahat na hindi kayo nakakalimutan ng gobyerno.''
''No, because it's a violation of human rights.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 13, 2015

''Umiba 'yong posisyon ko no'ng ipinasa ang Republic Act 9262, 'yong Anti-Violence against women and children... Kaya sa akin naman, hindi na kailangan. May ibang relief na available... Ang sa akin lang siguro, kailangan lang ma-amend 'yong existing declaration of nullity of marriage to make it more accessible sa mga mahihirap. Siguro i-relax 'yong requirements na kahit sana 'yong mahihirap... kapag na-relax lang 'yon tapos with RA 9262, I don't think there is a need to file.'' - Interview at TV5 during 'Happy Hour' segment, Nov. 13, 2015
''No, because it will send a wrong message.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 13, 2015

''Isinusulong natin ang NLUA. Pag-aralan na talaga kung anu-ano bang bahagi ng ating bansa ang hindi na talaga maaa-ring ilaan para sa agrikultura... Kasi tuwing may kalamidad, talagang nagdurusa ang ating mga magsasaka... Saan ba itatayo ang mga kabahayan? Saan ba hindi puwedeng tirhan? Para everytime na may sakuna na darating... hindi na ganoon kalaki ang damage na madalas pinagdadaanan natin.''

''Oo naman kasi atin 'yon eh, atin 'yon. 'Yong kayamanan na 'yon, sa tao 'yon, na obligasyon ng gobyernong habulin hanggang maibalik sa tunay na nagmamay-ari.'' - Interview with Interaksyon, Feb. 17, 2016

QUALIFIED YES
''Ika-qualify ko. I am not against labor export but only if it is an option. Not that they don't have any option here anymore but because it is their choice. Kasi ang nangyayari umaalis sila because they don't have a choice anymore.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 13, 2015

''I believe that any irregularity in the PDAF will escape the scrutiny of the representatives involved (in the misuse of pork barrel). She said that those representatives found involved in the scam must be penalized 'for the sake of the institution (referring to the House of Representatives)' ''.
''I think government should allow it. As a Catholic, hindi ko gagawin 'yon. Pero I think government should allow it because it is a basic human right.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 13, 2015

''My daughter is currently in Grade 10 this year and will be part of the full implementation of K to 12 next year as she enters Grade 11. That's why I see that the benefits outweigh these additional two years in high school.''

''Ako, I am in favor of extending the implementation (of CARP) para maibigay na ang dapat na ibigay. Pero at the same time, sana magkaroon na ng independent agrarian reform commission to look into the anomalies... I also think na 'yong intervention ng government should not end in the giving of lots. Kasi if we don't capacitate them, parang nasasayang tuloy 'yong pagbigay. Kaya sa akin lang, sana mas maging comprehensive 'yong programa.'' - Interview during TV5's 'Happy Hour' segment, Nov. 13, 2015
''Peace talks with anyone is always best talk.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 13, 2015

''Ako 'yong posisyon ko kasi d'yan, dapat 'yong karapatan na binibigay kay President Arroyo available din sa lahat. Hindi p'wedeng parang may special treatment just because it is her. Kung mayroong mga karapatan na ibibigay sa kanya, dapat 'yong karapatan na ito, available din sa lahat.'' - Interview with Interaksyon, Feb. 17, 2016

''Ako kasi, 'yong assumption d'yan, may katiwalian. 'Yong sa akin, yung sagot ko diyan, lahat ng klaseng katiwalian dapat i-pursige ng gobyernong suyurin, hindi 'yong DAP as a concept pero lahat ng klase ng katiwalaan. Kailangan hindi hihinto ang gobyerno hangga't hindi napaparusahan 'yong lahat ng nagkasala.'' - Interview with Interaksyon, Feb. 17, 2016
